Around 55% of businesses reported using AI in 2023 to 72% in 2024, according to a McKinsey Report, and ecommerce brands are leading the charge.AI is reshaping everything from marketing to supply chain operations, helping forward-looking brands combat rising customer acquisition costs and shrinking margins. Now, brands must adopt AI to keep from falling behind in the crowded marketplace—but more than that, they have to decide how far they’re willing to let AI take them.Yet, your mission as an ecommerce leader hasn’t changed: deliver better results with fewer resources. Here’s how ecommerce businesses can use AI—from improving marketing efficiency to the customer shopping experience—and 13 AI tools to help you do it. AI-powered solutions to slash marketing costs and drive growthMarketing leaders are grappling with rising customer acquisition costs (CAC) and diminishing engagement across channels. The “do more with less” mantra (the year's unofficial theme) puts marketing efficiency front and center—and AI is stepping up to help.AI helps marketers launch faster campaigns, monitor campaign effectiveness, and generate personalized messages at scale. According to Statista, 89% of marketers say using AI saves them an hour or more on a typical campaign launch. And 68% of marketers say customer engagement increased after using AI in their marketing campaigns.Here are some AI tools that help marketers stay efficient when marketing their ecommerce brands and mobile apps.Vista SocialBest for: Small to mid-sized businessesVista Social is your all-in-one tool for posting, tracking audience insights, planning feeds, and more.
